definitions.definition: A gaseous, toxic compound of hydrogen and nitrogen , NH 3 , with a pungent smell and taste.
A solution of this compound in water used domestically as a cleaning fluid.
examples: Never use ammonia to clean metal writing pens.

main_definition: ( inorganic chemistry ) A gaseous, toxic compound of hydrogen and nitrogen , NH 3 , with a pungent smell and taste.
secondary_definitions: A solution of this compound in water used domestically as a cleaning fluid.
